thread.title: State roundup: Wayne State rallies past Northern
thread.title_full: State roundup: Wayne State rallies past Northern

author: detroitnews.com
title: State roundup: Wayne State rallies past Northern
text:
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Detroit — D.J. Zezula threw a 7-yard touchdown pass to Will Wheat with 36 seconds left to cap Wayne State’s comeback in a 34-31 win over Northern Michigan in a Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference game Saturday afternoon.
Wayne State (3-4, 2-4) trailed 31-20 entering the fourth quarter but tightened the gap on field goals of 35 and 27 yards by Paul Graham less than three minutes apart to make it a one-possesion game.
Then on Wayne State’s final drive, Zezula connected with Wheat and ran in the ensuing two-point conversion to provide the finishing touches on an 8-play, 80-yard drive in the waning minutes.
Zezula finished 17-of-27 for 175 yards and Wheat had three catches for 33 yards, yet most of Wayne State’s damage was done on the ground. Romello Brown led the rushing attack with 157 yards on 26 carries, including touchdown runs of 1 and 10 yards. Demetrius Stinson added a 1-yard rushing score in the first.
Shaye Brown threw for 344 yards, three touchdowns and an interception on 24-of-38 passing for Northern Michigan (4-3, 3-3), which was held to 34 yards rushing.
Brown had touchdown passes of 39 yards to Marcus Tucker (seven catches, 88 yards), 58 yards to Keyondre Craig (five receptions, 96 yards) and 12 yards to Paris Woods (four catches, 61 yards).
Edward Christia scored on his lone carry of the game, a 1-yard run late in the second that gave Northern Michigan a 17-13 lead at halftime.
More GLIAC 
(At) Ashland 52, Hillsdale 21: Travis Tarnowski completed 21-of-29 passes for 360 yards and four touchdowns for Ashland (7-0), which posted 639 yards of total offense. Tarnowski threw touchdown passes of 3 and 7 yards to Adam Shaheen, 13 yards to Maxwell Shawver and 44 yards to Jamie Hence. Vance Settlemire, Michael Taylor and Jordan McCune each added a rushing touchdown. For Hillsdale (1-6), Chance Stewart scored on a 7-yard run and threw touchdown passes of 8 and 9 yards to Kegan Smith and Brian Newman.
(At) Ferris State 38, Ohio Dominican 17: Ferris State kept its unbeaten record intact behind a potent rushing attack led by Jason Vander Laan, who rushed for 161 yards and two touchdowns on 28 carries. Vander Laan scored on runs of 53 and 3 yards and also threw for 159 yards, including an 18-yard touchdown pass to Shakur Sanders to open the scoring. Jake Lampman added a 3-yard rushing touchdown and Robert Thomas scored on a 9-yard run for Ferris State (6-0), which outgained Ohio Dominican 442-240.
(At) Findlay 37, Northwood 34 (OT): Jared Briguglio rushed for 97 yards and two touchdowns on 22 attempts, Andre Carter scored on a 8-yard run, Bryce Lindberg scored on a 34-yard run and Theron Wilson had five catches for 129 yards for Northwood (3-4).
(At) Grand Valley State 38, Michigan Tech 21: Trailing 7-0 in the first, Grand Valley (6-1, 5-1) scored 24 unanswered points and never looked back. Bart Williams was 16-of-26 for 280 yards and threw touchdown passes of 17 and 49 yards to Jamie Potts and 11 yards to Brandon Bean. Kirk Spencer rushed for 103 yards on 13 attempts and threw a 3-yard touchdown pass to Nick Keizer. Brandon Cowie had 323 yards passing and a 19-yard touchdown pass to Ian Fischer for Michigan Tech (5-1). Alex Sherbinow added two rushing touchdowns and David Walter racked up 15 catches for 158 yards.
(At) Saginaw Valley 37, Lake Erie 34: Saginaw Valley staved off a furious fourth-quarter comeback by Lake Erie to hold on for its first win. Brad Odeman Jr. and Malik Washington led Saginaw Valley (1-6, 1-5) with a pair of touchdowns each. Odeman threw a 32-yard touchdown pass to Max Corcoran and a 24-yarder to Bryan Fobbs, while Washington tallied 107 yards rushing on 20 carries and scored on runs of 32 and 2 yards. Anthony Bilal rushed for 183 yards and four touchdowns on 30 attempts, Shane Van Fleteren had six catches for 108 yards and John Banyasz scored on a a 3-yard run for Lake Erie (1-6, 1-5).
MIAA 
(At) Albion 30, Adrian 25: Dominic Bona threw for 229 yards and a touchdown on 22-of-34 passing, Colin Parks rushed for 102 yards and two scores on 15 carries, and Mike Czarnecki had an 8-yard rushing touchdown for Albion (6-0, 3-0). Emanuel Stewart had 226 yards rushing and scored on runs of 9, 65 and 42 yards for Adrian (3-3, 1-2).
(At) Alma 36, Kalamazoo 27: Dylan Zaborowski completed 26-of-50 passes for 328 yards and three touchdowns for Alma (3-3, 1-2). He connected on scores of 2 and 70 yards to Erik Hines and 33 yards to Sean McDonald. McDonald also had a 27-yard touchdown reception on Parrish TerBurgh’s lone pass attempt. Hines finished with nine catches for 162 yards and McDonald had eight receptions for 126 yards. For Kalamazoo (2-4, 0-2), Elijah Hamilton-Wray returned the opening kickoff 83 yards for a score and Alex White had three touchdown passes.
(At) Olivet 31, Hope 27: Braden Black led Olivet (6-0, 3-0) with 234 yards passing and four touchdowns, including two in the final two minutes to Kyle Bryson. Black threw touchdown passes of 16, 9 and 11 yards to Bryson (four catches, 40 yards) and 27 yards to Mitchell Bailey (eight catches, 104 yards). Zac Boersema had 128 yards rushing on 16 carries and scored on runs of 86, 4 and 1 yards, while Rob Kish connected with Kurtis Slenk on a 16-yard score for Hope (2-4, 0-2).
